page.title: 03HMS Hurworth
page.content: HMS Hurworth is named after Hurworth Hunt and has been adopted by the village.The first HMS Hurworth was sunk off the greek islands in 1946 by a mine. The old HMS Hurworth was a destroyer but the new one is a minesweeper.The name plate and the hunting horn went down with it.The new HMS Hurworth is made of fibreglass and plywood.The ship was launched in Southampton by Lady Halifax, whose husband is Vice Admiral of the Navy. The ship was launched backwards. HMS Hurworth has been on sea trials.It will be commissioned on the 18th of July by Vospers.The ships crew will get 2 pictures of Hurworth which will go in its wardroom.The ship is about 100 - 120ft long and has 58 crew.Its code number is M-39.It will be on patrol from Portsmouth to Falkirk for the next 2.5 years.
